subject: Travel
title: The Temple of Artemis
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Temple of Artemis.

hook.text: The Temple of Artemis at Ephesus was four times the size of the Parthenon in Athens.

buildup.text: It took 120 years to build and was funded by King Croesus, the richest man alive.

discovery.text: Over 100 marble columns stood inside, each 60 feet tall, donated by different sponsors.

twist.text: In 356 BC, a man named Herostratus burned it down purely to become famous.

climax.text: The Greeks rebuilt it even grander, but Goths destroyed it again in 262 AD.

punchline.text: Built twice, destroyed twice, remembered forever.

quiz.question: Why did Herostratus burn down the Temple of Artemis?
